history.content:
Probably best to ask Michael Sun, the coordinator for the 5th year masters program

His email is msun86@eecs.berkeley.edu (you could find this email address here: https://eecs.berkeley.edu/people/staff/student-affairs-staff)

As someone in the 5th year masters program, I think you'd have to find a faculty member (at least on the application theres a drop down menu of advisors you have to choose from). But if you know someone who is a "full-time researcher" in Berkeley EECS, odds are they work with a faculty who'd be willing to sponsor you anyways, so I'd just ask them about that

children.subject: The word "sponsor" here isn't in a monetary context - the 5th Year M.S. requires a faculty sponsor in the sense that your application must include a letter from a EE/CS faculty member of the Academic Senate that indicates their commitment to being your mentor/advisor if admitted to the program.
what do you mean by sponsor, there's no research stipend involved with the 5th year masters right?

history.content: Does the advisor need to be an actual Professor/Assistant Professor in EECS or can my advisor just be a “Full Time Researcher” in Berkeley EECS. I’m currently working with the latter and have a much closer connection, but not sure if that qualifies as someone who is willing to take me in.
history.subject: EECS 5th Years Masters Advisor Question
